data: The report states 'Number of positive lymph nodes: 0. Total number sampled: 3.' This indicates that there is no metastasis in the lymph nodes, so the N stage is N0.
N0

Based on the report, there is metastasis in one sentinel lymph node (right axilla sentinel node, biopsy) and no evidence of carcinoma in 14 lymph nodes (right axilla, dissection). Therefore, the N stage is N1.
N1

The N stage is determined by the number of lymph nodes with cancer. In this report, seven out of eleven examined lymph nodes have metastatic carcinoma. Therefore, the N stage is N2 (metastasis in 4 to 9 axillary lymph nodes).
N2

The N stage is determined by the number of lymph nodes with cancer. According to the report, 'B. LEFT AXILLARY CONTENTS, DISSECTION: METASTATIC CARCINOMA INVOLVING 18 OF 20 EXAMINED LYMPH NODES.' This indicates that 18 lymph nodes have metastatic carcinoma, which falls under N3 (metastasis in 10 or more axillary lymph nodes). The involvement of the supraclavicular lymph node does not change the N stage in this context.
N3
The report states '16 LYMPH NODES IDENTIFIED, ALL NEGATIVE FOR MALIGNANCY'. This means that there is no lymph node involvement, so the N stage is N0.
N0

Therefore, the N stage is N0.
